patterns: Do you offer a discount on fees?
Don't offer any discount on fees?

responses: No, there is no any scholarship or discount schemes for the students. However, with your excellent college performance, you could be provided with various internship opportunities within the college after the very first year .

patterns: What are the enrollment criteria to study in this college?
What are the entry requirements for this college?
What are the enrolment criteria to attend this college?
What are the entry criteria to study at this university?
What are the enrolment requirements to study at this college?
What are the enrolment criteria for that university?
What are the registration criteria for studying at the college?
What are the criteria for enrolling in this college?
responses:
For BIT, you need to have NEB +2 Qualification with atleast an aggregate of 2.2 GPA or >55% with atleast 2.4 GPA in English subject.
For BBA,  you need to have NEB +2 Qualification with atleast an aggregate of 1.8 GPA or >45% with atleast 1.8 GPA in English subject.
If you are an A-level Student, you need to have a minimum of 3.5 credits and at least a grade of D and above.

patterns: Do I need to give entrance exams?
Do I need to take entrance exams?
Should I have an entrance exam?
Do I have to pass entry examinations?
Is there an entrance exam to study in this college?
Are there entrance tests to study here?
Are there entry examinations to study at this college?
Do you have entrance examinations to study at this college?
Is there an entrance examination here?
responses:
No, you are not required to give any entrance exams, you only need to have satisfied the following enrollment criterias:
For BIT, you need to have NEB +2 Qualification with atleast an aggregate of 2.2 GPA or >55% with atleast 2.4 GPA in English subject.
For BBA,  you need to have NEB +2 Qualification with atleast an aggregate of 1.8 GPA or >45% with atleast 1.8 GPA in English subject.
If you are an A-level Student, you need to have a minimum of 3.5 credits and at least a grade of D and above.

patterns: What documents should I bring for admission?
Which documents must I bring for admission?
What documentation do I have to bring for admission?
What documents need to be brought for admission?
What documents do I have to bring for intake?
What documents do I need to carry for admission?
responses: You need to bring your citizenship certificate, transcript and provisional certificate, SLC/SEE marksheet, and character certificate for admission. If you do not have your citizenship certificate, you must bring your birth certificate. Also, you are required to bring your 11 and 12 grades marksheet, if you do not have your provisional or transcript. Lastly, you are required to bring either cash or cheque of Rs 96,000 as the admission fee.

patterns: When is the time for admission ?
What time is it to be admitted ?
When do you get into theCollege?
responses: There are two intakes for admission in a year, Autumn intake that starts around October-November, and Spring intake which starts around March-April. You can admit in the college in any of these  intakes.

patterns: Can a science student study BBA?
Is it possible for a science student to study BBA?
Can a science student learn BBA?
Is a science student allowed to study BBA?
Can a science student go to BBA?
Can an Undergraduate Science Student study BBA?
responses: Yes! no matter what's your +2 background, you can enroll in any courses in this college if you satisfy the enrollment criteria.

patterns: How much does it cost to study BBA?
What's the cost of studying BBA?
How much do you pay to study BBA?
How much does a BBA course cost?
How much is studying the BBA?
What does studying the BBA cost?
responses: The initial admission fee is Rs 96,000 that is one-time and non-refundable. Semester fees is Rs 42,000 which shall be paid before the start of each semester, (i.e. 8 semesters for BBA). The University fee is  Rs 1,00,000 which shall be paid every year before the starting of the semester. (i.e 4 times for 4 years in BBA). So, the total cost for the completion of the whole course will be about Rs 8,32,000 for BBA. Moreover, there are no any hidden costs and fees included other than the ones mentioned.

patterns: What is the fee structure for BIT?
What is the pricing structure of BIT?
responses: The initial admission fee is Rs 96,000 that is one-time and non-refundable. Semester fees is Rs 70,000 which shall be paid before the start of each semester, (i.e. 6 semesters for BIT). The University fee is  Rs 1,00,000 which shall be paid every year before the starting of the semester. (i.e 3 times for 3 years in BIT). So, the total cost for the completion of the whole course will be about Rs 8,16,000 for BIT. Moreover, there are no any hidden costs and fees included other than the ones mentioned.

patterns: How many year course is bit
responses: The academic program is 3 years long. This curriculum aims to provide students with knowledge of core computer science concepts by integrating them with current computer languages, methods, techniques, and methodologies used by computer professionals worldwide.

patterns: How many year course is bba
responses: The academic program is 4 years long. BBA is designed to address the need of the students to learn about themselves as well as the professional world that surrounds them.

patterns: How many year course is mba
responses: The academic program is 2 years long. The two-year programme is a gateway to a plethora of job opportunities in the corporate world.

patterns: What courses are there in the college?
What courses does the college offer?
What courses do you have in college?
What courses exist at the college?
Which courses are offered at the college?
What courses are available at college?
responses: The college provides two courses that are BBA, BIT and MBA

patterns: What subjects are there in BIT?
Can you tell me anything about BIT?
Can you tell us more about BIT?
Please tell me more about BIT?
Can you give me more information on BIT?
responses: The academic program is 3 years long. Year 1: Introductory Programming and Problem Solving,  Fundamentals of Computing,  Embedded System Programming, Computational Mathematics, Internet Software Architecture. Year 2: Concepts and Technologies of AI, Object-Oriented Design and Programming, Distributed and Cloud System Programming, Human Computer Interaction, Numerical Methods and Concurrency. Year 3: Complex System,  High Performance Computing, Project and Professionalism, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, Big Data

patterns: What subjects are there in BBA?
responses: The academic program is 4 years long. Year 1: Basic Research, Computer & IT Applications, English Language & Composition, Basic Statistics, Principles of Management, Financial Accounting and Reporting I, Applied Mathematics for Business. Year 2: Financial Accounting and Reporting II, Micro-economics, Applied Sociology, Introduction to Marketing, Macro-economics, Management Accounting, Finance. Year 3: Investment, Human Resource Management, Retail Management, Logic and Reasoning, International Business Management, Introduction to International Relations, Operations Management. Year 4: Research Methods & Skills, Exploring Strategy, New Enterprise Creation, Logistics and Supply Chain Management, Organization Behaviour, Advertising & Marketing Communications

patterns: What subjects are there in MBA?
responses: The academic program is 2 years long. Year 1: Advanced Management Concepts Analysis, Organizational Behavior for Managers, Data Analysis for Managers, Global Sustainable Development, Business Economics, Directing Strategy for Value Creation, New Business Development, Introduction to Behavioral Finance. Year 2: Accounting for Managers, Business Management Consulting & Research, Strategic Marketing for Managers, Leadership Power & Policy for Managers, Financial Management, Human Resource Management, International Marketing, Operations & Supply Chain Management.
